intro: Phyllanthus avanguiensis, commonly known as the African buttonwood, is a shrub native to tropical Africa. It belongs to the family Euphorbiaceae and is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves that are often clustered at the base of the stems. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers and is known for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland and savanna habitats. Due to its ecological and potential pharmacological significance, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
